member.summary: Indicates whether auto fit row height when the cells is merged in a row. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If the cells in merged in a row and auto fit the rows in MS Excel, MS Excel do not expand the row height. If this option is true, Aspose.Cells will expand the row height to fit the cells' data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Cell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula of the .
member.remarks:
A formula string always begins with an equal sign (=). And please always use comma(,) as parameters delimeter, such as "=SUM(A1, E1, H2)".
User can set any formula in Workbook designer file. Aspose.Cells will keep all the formulas. If user use this property to set a formula to a cell, major part of Workbook built-in functions is supported. And more is coming. If you have any special need for Workbook built-in functions, please let us know.

member.summary: Indicates how the specified control will display Null values.
member.remarks:
///
Setting Description
TrueThe control will cycle through states for Yes, No, and Null values. The control appears dimmed (grayed) when its Value property is set to Null.
False(Default) The control will cycle through states for Yes and No values. Null values display as if they were No values.

member.summary: Indicates how the specified control will display Null values.
member.remarks:
///
Setting Description
TrueThe control will cycle through states for Yes, No, and Null values. The control appears dimmed (grayed) when its Value property is set to Null.
False(Default) The control will cycle through states for Yes and No values. Null values display as if they were No values.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.GradientFill.SetOneColorGradient(System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,Aspose.Cells.Drawing.GradientStyleType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified fill to a one-color gradient.
member.param: The gradient degree. Can be a value from 0.0 (dark) through 1.0 (light).

The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.summary: Sets the specified fill to a two-color gradient.
member.param: The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Drawing.GradientFill.SetTwoColorGradient(System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,Aspose.Cells.Drawing.GradientStyleType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified fill to a two-color gradient.
member.param: The degree of transparency of the color1 as a value from 0.0 (opaque) through 1.0 (clear).
The degree of transparency of the color2 as a value from 0.0 (opaque) through 1.0 (clear).

The gradient variant. Can be a value from 1 through 4, corresponding to one of the four variants on the Gradient tab in the Fill Effects dialog box. If style is GradientStyle.FromCenter, the Variant argument can only be 1 or 2.

member.param: The gradient degree. Can be a value from 0.0 (dark) through 1.0 (light).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.PivotSource
member.summary: The source is the data of the pivotTable. If PivotSource is not empty ,the chart is PivotChart.
member.remarks: If the pivot table "PivotTable1" in the Worksheet "Sheet1" in the file "Book1.xls". The pivotSource could be "[Book1.xls]Sheet1!PivotTable1" if the chart and the PivotTable is not in the same workbook. If you set this property ,the previous data source setting will be lost.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.IsChartDataChanged
member.summary: Detects if a chart's data source has changed.
member.remarks: The method detects the changes in the chart's data source before rendering the chart to image format. At first Chart.toImage call, the chart source data (e.g. XValuesParseData, ValuesParseData) will be recorded. Before calling the Chart.toImage method again, call IsChartDataChanged method to check if Chart needs re-rendering.
member.returns: Returns true if the chart has changed otherwise returns false

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.RefreshPivotData
member.summary: Refreshes pivot chart's data from it's pivot data source.
member.remarks: We will gather data from pivot data source to the pivot chart cache. This method is only used to gather all data to a pivot chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.GapWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.GapDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the data series in a 3-D chart, as a percentage of the marker width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.summary: Calcuate the custom position of plot area, axises if the position of them are auto assigned.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the walls of a 3-D chart.
member.remarks: This property doesn't apply to 3-D pie charts.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the walls of a 3-D chart.
member.remarks: This property doesn't apply to 3-D pie charts.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the back wall of a 3-D chart.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the side wall of a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.WallsAndGridlines2D
member.summary: True if gridlines are drawn two-dimensionally on a 3-D chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.RotationAngle
member.summary: Represents the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis, in degrees).
member.remarks: The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Rotation
member.summary: Represents the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis, in degrees).
member.remarks: The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts.

NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Chart.RotationAngle property. This property will be removed 12 months later since June 2010. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Elevation
member.summary: Represents the elevation of the 3-D chart view, in degrees.
member.remarks: The chart elevation is the height at which you view the chart, in degrees. The default is 15 for most chart types. The value of this property must be between -90 and 90, except for 3-D bar charts, where it must be between 0 and 44.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: True if the chart axes are at right angles.Applies only for 3-D charts(except Column3D and 3-D Pie Charts).
member.remarks: If this property is True, the Perspective property is ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.AutoScaling
member.summary: True if Microsoft Excel scales a 3-D chart so that it's closer in size to the equivalent 2-D chart. The RightAngleAxes property must be True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.HeightPercent
member.summary: Returns or sets the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets the perspective for the 3-D chart view. Must be between 0 and 100. This property is ignored if the RightAngleAxes property is True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.Is3D
member.summary: Indicates whether the chart is a 3d chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.DepthPercent
member.summary: Represents the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file. The extension of the file name determines the format of the image.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
member.remarks: The format of the image is specified by using the extension of the file name. For example, if you specify "myfile.png", then the image will be saved in the PNG format. The following file extensions are recognized: .bmp, .gif, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .tif, .emf. If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file in the Jpeg format.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
member.remarks: If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a stream in the Jpeg format.
member.remarks: If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.String,Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file. The extension of the file name determines the format of the image.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
member.remarks: The format of the image is specified by using the extension of the file name. For example, if you specify "myfile.png", then the image will be saved in the PNG format. The following file extensions are recognized: .bmp, .gif, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .tif, .emf. If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Chart.ToImage(System.IO.Stream,Aspose.Cells.Rendering.ImageOrPrintOptions)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a stream in the specified format.
member.remarks: The format of the image is specified by using options.ImageFormat. The following formats are supported: ImageFormat.Bmp, ImageFormat.Gif, ImageFormat.Png, ImageFormat.Jpeg, ImageFormat.Tiff, ImageFormat.Emf. If the width or height is zero or the chart is not supported according to Supported Charts List, this method will do nothing. Please refer to Supported Charts List for more details.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType
member.summary: Represents the way the two sections of either a pie of pie chart or a bar of pie chart are split.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.Position
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the last Split Position of the data points in the second chart

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.Value
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the data points with value less than Split Position in the second chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.PercentValue
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the points with percentage less than Split Position percent in the second chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.Custom
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart according to the InnerCustom Split values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.Charts.ChartSplitType.Auto
member.summary: Represents the data points shall be split using the default mechanism for this chart type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea
member.summary: Encapsulates the object that represents the plot area in a chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.PlotArea.X
member.summary: Gets or gets the x coordinate of the upper left corner of plot-area bounding box in units of 1/4000 of the chart area.

remarks.p: The plot-area bounding box includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If the value is not created by MS Excel, please call Chart.Calculate() method before calling this method.

The X, Y, Width and Height of PlotArea represents the plot-area bounding box that includes the plot area, tick marks(tick labels), and a small border around the tick marks. If you want to get actual size of plot area, you should call InnerX, InnerY, InnerWidth and InnerHeight properties.
For excel 2007 or latter, the defaut value is zero. you should call get the value after calling Chart.Calculate().

member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Marker.MarkerForegroundColorSetType property. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2012. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. FormattingType.Automatic is same as ChartLineFormattingType.Automatic. FormattingType.None is same as ChartLineFormattingType.None. FormattingType.InnerCustom is same as ChartLineFormattingType.Solid.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.MarkerBackgroundColor
member.summary: Represents the marker background color in a line chart, scatter chart, or radar chart.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Marker.MarkerBackgroundColor property. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2012. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.MarkerBackgroundColorSetType
member.summary: Gets or sets the marker background color set type.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Marker.MarkerBackgroundColorSetType property. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2012. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced. FormattingType.Automatic is same as ChartLineFormattingType.Automatic. FormattingType.None is same as ChartLineFormattingType.None. FormattingType.InnerCustom is same as ChartLineFormattingType.Solid.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.PlotOnSecondAxis
member.summary: Indicates if this series is plotted on second value axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.XErrorBar
member.summary: Represents X direction error bar of the series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.YErrorBar
member.summary: Represents Y direction error bar of the series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HasHiLoLines
member.summary: True if the line chart has high-low lines. Applies only to line charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HiLoLines
member.summary: Returns a HiLoLines object that represents the high-low lines for a series on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HasSeriesLines
member.summary: True if a stacked column chart or bar chart has series lines or if a Pie of Pie chart or Bar of Pie chart has connector lines between the two sections. Applies only to stacked column charts, bar charts, Pie of Pie charts, or Bar of Pie charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SeriesLines
member.summary: Returns a SeriesLines object that represents the series lines for a stacked bar chart or a stacked column chart. Applies only to stacked bar and stacked column charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HasDropLines
member.summary: True if the chart has drop lines. Applies only to line chart or area charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.DropLines
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the drop lines for a series on the line chart or area chart. Applies only to line chart or area charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HasUpDownBars
member.summary: True if a line chart has up and down bars. Applies only to line charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.UpBars
member.summary: Returns an DropBars object that represents the up bars on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.DownBars
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the down bars on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.IsColorVaried
member.summary: Represents if the color of points is varied. The chart must contain only one series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.GapWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the first pie-chart or doughnut-chart slice, in degrees (clockwise from vertical). Applies only to pie, 3-D pie, and doughnut charts, 0 to 360.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how bars and columns are positioned. Can be a value between – 100 and 100. Applies only to 2-D bar and 2-D column charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SecondPlotSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the secondary section of either a pie of pie chart or a bar of pie chart, as a percentage of the size of the primary pie. Can be a value from 5 to 200.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SplitType
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that how to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie of pie or bar of pie chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SplitValue
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that shall be used to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie of pie or bar of pie chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.IsAutoSplit
member.summary: Indicates whether the threshold value is automatic.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.BubbleScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale factor for bubbles in the specified chart group. It can be an integer value from 0 (zero) to 300, corresponding to a percentage of the default size. Applies only to bubble charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.SizeRepresents
member.summary: Gets or sets what the bubble size represents on a bubble chart.
member.remarks: BubbleSizeRepresents.SizeIsArea means the value is the area of the bubble. BubbleSizeRepresents.SizeIsWidth means the value is the width of the bubble.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.ShowNegativeBubbles
member.summary: True if negative bubbles are shown for the chart group. Valid only for bubble charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.DoughnutHoleSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of the hole in a doughnut chart group. The hole size is expressed as a percentage of the chart size, between 10 and 90 percent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.Explosion
member.summary: The distance of an open pie slice from the center of the pie chart is expressed as a percentage of the pie diameter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HasRadarAxisLabels
member.summary: True if a radar chart has category axis labels. Applies only to radar charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.HasLeaderLines
member.summary: True if the series has leader lines.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.LeaderLines
member.summary: Represents leader lines on a chart. Leader lines connect data labels to data points. This object isn’t a collection; there’s no object that represents a single leader line.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.LegendEntry
member.summary: Gets the legend entry according to this series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Series.ShapeProperties
member.summary: Gets the object that holds the visual shape properties of the Series.

member.summary: Gets and sets the display mode of the background

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.TickLabels.RotationAngle
member.summary: Represents text rotation angle in clockwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.TickLabels.NumberFormat
member.summary: Represents the format string for the TickLabels object.
member.remarks: The formating string is same as a custom format string setting to a cell. For example, "$0".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.TickLabels.Number
member.summary: Represents the format number for the TickLabels object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.TickLabels.NumberFormatLinked
member.summary: True if the number format is linked to the cells (so that the number format changes in the labels when it changes in the cells).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.TickLabels.Offset
member.summary: Represents the distance between the levels of labels, and the distance between the first level and the axis line.
member.remarks: The default distance is 100 percent, which represents the default spacing between the axis labels and the axis line. The value can be an integer percentage from 0 through 1000, relative to the axis label’s font size.

member.summary: Represents text reading order.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline
member.summary: Represents a trendline in a chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.IsNameAuto
member.summary: Returns if Microsoft Excel automatically determines the name of the trendline.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Type
member.summary: Returns the trendline type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Name
member.summary: Returns the name of the trendline.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Order
member.summary: Returns or sets the trendline order (an integer greater than 1) when the trendline type is Polynomial. The order must be between 2 and 6.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Period
member.summary: Returns or sets the period for the moving-average trendline.
member.remarks: This value should be between 2 and 255. And it must be less than the number of the chart points in the series

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Forward
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of periods (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends forward. The number of periods must be greater than and equal to zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Backward
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of periods (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends backward. The number of periods must be greater than and equal to zero. If the chart type is column ,the number of periods must be between 0 and 0.5

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.DisplayEquation
member.summary: Represents if the equation for the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same data label as the R-squared value). Setting this property to True automatically turns on data labels.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.DisplayRSquared
member.summary: Represents if the R-squared value of the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same data label as the equation). Setting this property to True automatically turns on data labels.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Charts.Trendline.Intercept
member.summary: Returns or sets the point where the trendline crosses the value axis.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Charts.SparklineGroup
member.summary: is organized into sparkline group. A SparklineGroup contains a variable number of sparkline items. A sparkline group specifies the type, display settings and axis settings for the sparklines.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.Charts.SparklineGroup.ResetRanges(System.String,System.Boolean,Aspose.Cells.CellArea)
member.summary: Resets the data range and location range of the sparkline group. This method will clear original sparkline items in the group and creates new sparkline items for the new ranges.
member.param: Specifies the new data range of the sparkline group.
Specifies whether to plot the sparklines from the new data range by row or by column.
Specifies where the sparklines to be placed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition
member.summary: Specifies the axis position for a range of cells with conditional formatting as data bars.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.DataBarAxisAutomatic
member.summary: Display the axis at a variable position based on the ratio of the minimum negative value to the maximum positive value in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction. When all values are positive or all values are negative, no axis is displayed.
member.remarks: NOTE: This enum type is now obsolete. Instead, please use DataBarAxisPosition.Automatic enum type. This property will be removed 12 months later since December 2013. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.DataBarAxisMidpoint
member.summary: Display the axis at the midpoint of the cell regardless of the set of values in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction.
member.remarks: NOTE: This enum type is now obsolete. Instead, please use DataBarAxisPosition.Midpoint enum type. This property will be removed 12 months later since December 2013. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.DataBarAxisNone
member.summary: No axis is displayed, and both positive and negative values are displayed in the left-to-right direction.
member.remarks: NOTE: This enum type is now obsolete. Instead, please use DataBarAxisPosition.None enum type. This property will be removed 12 months later since December 2013. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.Automatic
member.summary: Display the axis at a variable position based on the ratio of the minimum negative value to the maximum positive value in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction. When all values are positive or all values are negative, no axis is displayed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.Midpoint
member.summary: Display the axis at the midpoint of the cell regardless of the set of values in the range. Positive values are displayed in a left-to-right direction. Negative values are displayed in a right-to-left direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.DataBarAxisPosition.None
member.summary: No axis is displayed, and both positive and negative values are displayed in the left-to-right direction.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage
member.summary: Describe the AboveAverage conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.IsAboveAverage
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether the rule is an "above average" rule. 'true' indicates 'above average'. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.IsEqualAverage
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether the 'aboveAverage' and 'belowAverage' criteria is inclusive of the average itself, or exclusive of that value. 'true' indicates to include the average value in the criteria. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AboveAverage.StdDev
member.summary: Get or set the number of standard deviations to include above or below the average in the conditional formatting rule. The input value must between 0 and 3 (include 0 and 3). Setting this value to 0 means stdDev is not set. The default value is 0.

member.summary: Get or set the Greater Than Or Equal flag. Use only for icon sets, determines whether this threshold value uses the greater than or equal to operator. 'false' indicates 'greater than' is used instead of 'greater than or equal to'. Default value is true.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType
member.summary: Conditional format rule type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.CellValue
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule compares a cell value to a formula calculated result, using an operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.Expression
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule contains a formula to evaluate. When the formula result is true, the cell is highlighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ColorScale
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule creates a gradated color scale on the cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.DataBar
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule displays a gradated data bar in the range of cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.IconSet
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule applies icons to cells according to their values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.Top10
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top N or bottom N bracket, as specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.UniqueValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights unique values in the range.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.DuplicateValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights duplicated values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing given text. Equivalent to using the SEARCH() sheet function to determine whether the cell contains the text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.BeginsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells in the range that begin with the given text. Equivalent to using the LEFT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.EndsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells ending with given text. Equivalent to using the RIGHT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are completely blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.ContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells with formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.NotContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells without formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.TimePeriod
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing dates in the specified time period. The underlying value of the cell is evaluated, therefore the cell does not need to be formatted as a date to be evaluated. For example, with a cell containing the value 38913 the conditional format shall be applied if the rule requires a value of 7/14/2006.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionType.AboveAverage
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType
member.summary: Condition value type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Formula
member.summary: The minimum/ midpoint / maximum value for the gradient is determined by a formula.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Max
member.summary: Indicates that the maximum value in the range shall be used as the maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Min
member.summary: Indicates that the minimum value in the range shall be used as the minimum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Number
member.summary: Indicates that the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient is specified by a constant numeric value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Percent
member.summary: Value indicates a percentage between the minimum and maximum values in the range shall be used as the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.Percentile
member.summary: Value indicates a percentile ranking in the range shall be used as the minimum / midpoint / maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.AutomaticMax
member.summary: Indicates that the Automatic maximum value in the range shall be used as the Automatic maximum value for the gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.FormatConditionValueType.AutomaticMin
member.summary: Indicates that the Automatic minimum value in the range shall be used as the Automatic minimum value for the gradient.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Top10
member.summary: Describe the Top10 conditional formatting rule. This conditional formatting rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top N or bottom N bracket, as specified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Top10.IsPercent
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether a "top/bottom n" rule is a "top/bottom n percent" rule. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Top10.IsBottom
member.summary: Get or set the flag indicating whether a "top/bottom n" rule is a "bottom n" rule. '1' indicates 'bottom'. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Top10.Rank
member.summary: Get or set the value of "n" in a "top/bottom n" conditional formatting rule. If IsPercent is true, the value must between 0 and 100. Otherwise it must between 0 and 1000. Default value is 10.

member.summary: The default path(URL) saved in generated html file for the referred source. For example, the sheet data saved in xxx_files/sheet001.htm, the url used in the main html file should be like "src="xxx_files/sheet001.htm""

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.StreamProviderOptions.CustomPath
member.summary: The user custom path(URL) saved in generated html file for the referred source. If not defined by user, DefaultPath will be used. For example, the sheet data will be saved by user to d:/sheet001.htm, the url used in the main html file should be "d:/sheet001.htm" or other valid relative path that can be accessed by the main html file.

member.summary: CopyOptions constructor.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.ExtendToAdjacentRange
member.summary: Indicates whether extend ranges when copying the range to adjacent range.
member.remarks: If it's true, only extends the range of the hyperlink,not adding a new hyperlink when copying hyperlinks to adjacent rows.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.CopyNames
member.summary: Indicates whether copying the names.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.CopyInvalidFormulasAsValues
member.summary: If the formula is not valid for the dest destination, only copy values.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.ColumnCharacterWidth
member.summary: Indicates whether copying column width in unit of characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.ReferToSheetWithSameName
member.summary: When copying a worksheet to another workbook and the worksheet contains the formulas which refer to other worksheets in MS Excel, the copied formulas should refer to source workbook. But sometimes we have copied other worksheets and we hope the copied formulas refer to other worksheets with the name in the same workbook, please set this property as true.
member.remarks: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CopyOptions.ReferToDestinationSheet
member.summary: When copying the range in the same file and the chart refers to the source sheet, False means the copied chart's data source will not be changed. True means the copied chart's data source refers to the destination sheet.
member.remarks: The default value is false, it works as MS Excel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.DataTable
member.summary: Gets and sets the DataTable which columns's data type is assigned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.ExportColumnName
member.summary: Indicates whether the data in the first row are exported to the column name of the DataTable. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.SkipErrorValue
member.summary: Indicates whether skip invalid value for the column. For example,if the column type is decimal ,the value is greater than decimal.MaxValue and this property is true,we will not throw exception again. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.PlotVisibleCells
member.summary: Only exports visible cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.PlotVisibleRows
member.summary: Only exports visible rows.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.PlotVisibleColumns
member.summary: Only exports visible columns.

member.summary: Exports the string value of the cells to the DataTable.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.ExportAsHtmlString
member.summary: Exports the html string value of the cells to the DataTable.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.FormatStrategy
member.summary: Gets and sets the format strategy when exporting the value as string value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.CheckMixedValueType
member.summary: False, Aspose.Cells will set the DataColumn's type by the value type of the first row for performance. True, Aspose.Cells will check whether the value type in the column are mixed before set the DataColumn's type And the value type are mixed, the DataColumn's type will be string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.IsVertical
member.summary: True if a row in Workbook file represents a row in DataTable. False if a column in Workbook file represents a row in DataTable.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.Indexes
member.summary: The indexes of columns/rows which should be exported out.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExportTableOptions.RenameStrategy
member.summary: Renames strategy when columns contains the duplicate names.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection
member.summary: Specifies all properties associated with an ODBC or OLE DB external data connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.ConnectionInfo
member.summary: The connection information string is used to make contact with an OLE DB or ODBC data source.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.CommandType
member.summary: Specifies the OLE DB command type. 1. Query specifies a cube name 2. Query specifies a SQL statement 3. Query specifies a table name 4. Query specifies that default information has been given, and it is up to the provider how to interpret. 5. Query is against a web based List Data Provider.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.DBConnection.Command
member.summary: The string containing the database command to pass to the data provider API that will interact with the external source in order to retrieve data

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection
member.summary: Specifies an external data connection

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Id
member.summary: Gets the id of the connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Type
member.summary: Gets or Sets the external connection DataSource type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SourceFile
member.summary: Used when the external data source is file-based. When a connection to such a data source fails, the spreadsheet application attempts to connect directly to this file. May be expressed in URI or system-specific file path notation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SSOId
member.summary: Identifier for Single Sign On (SSO) used for authentication between an intermediate spreadsheetML server and the external data source.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SavePassword
member.summary: True if the password is to be saved as part of the connection string; otherwise, False.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.SaveData
member.summary: True if the external data fetched over the connection to populate a table is to be saved with the workbook; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.RefreshOnLoad
member.summary: True if this connection should be refreshed when opening the file; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ReconnectionMethodType
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails.The default value is ReConnectionMethodType.Required.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.OnlyUseConnectionFile
member.summary: Indicates whether the spreadsheet application should always and only use the connection information in the external connection file indicated by the odcFile attribute when the connection is refreshed. If false, then the spreadsheet application should follow the procedure indicated by the reconnectionMethod attribute

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.OdcFile
member.summary: Specifies the full path to external connection file from which this connection was created. If a connection fails during an attempt to refresh data, and reconnectionMethod=1, then the spreadsheet application will try again using information from the external connection file instead of the connection object embedded within the workbook.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.IsNew
member.summary: True if the connection has not been refreshed for the first time; otherwise, false. This state can happen when the user saves the file before a query has finished returning.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the connection. Each connection must have a unique name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.KeepAlive
member.summary: True when the spreadsheet application should make efforts to keep the connection open. When false, the application should close the connection after retrieving the information.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.RefreshInternal
member.summary: Specifies the number of minutes between automatic refreshes of the connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ConnectionId
member.summary: Specifies The unique identifier of this connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.ConnectionDescription
member.summary: Specifies the user description for this connection

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.IsDeleted
member.summary: Indicates whether the associated workbook connection has been deleted. true if the connection has been deleted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.CredentialsMethodType
member.summary: Specifies the authentication method to be used when establishing (or re-establishing) the connection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Credentials
member.summary: Specifies the authentication method to be used when establishing (or re-establishing) the connection.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Instead, please use ExternalConnection.CredentialsMethodType property. This property will be removed 12 months later since October 2017. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.BackgroundRefresh
P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ExternalConnection.Parameters
member.summary: Gets for an ODBC or web query.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection
member.summary: Specifies the properties for a web query source. A web query will retrieve data from HTML tables, and can also supply HTTP "Get" parameters to be processed by the web server in generating the HTML by including the parameters and parameter elements.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXml
member.summary: true if the web query source is XML (versus HTML), otherwise false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXl97
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadhseet files, and is set to true if this web query was created in Microsoft Excel 97. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsXl2000
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadsheet files, and is set to true if this web query was refreshed in a spreadsheet application newer than or equal to Microsoft Excel 2000. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.Url
member.summary: URL to use to refresh external data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsTextDates
member.summary: Flag indicating whether dates should be imported into cells in the worksheet as text rather than dates.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsSourceData
member.summary: Flag indicating that XML source data should be imported instead of the HTML table itself.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.Post
member.summary: Returns or sets the string used with the post method of inputting data into a web server to return data from a web query.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsParsePre
member.summary: Flag indicating whether data contained within HTML PRE tags in the web page is parsed into columns when you import the page into a query table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsHtmlTables
member.summary: Flag indicating whether web queries should only work on HTML tables.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.HtmlFormat
member.summary: How to handle formatting from the HTML source when bringing web query data into the worksheet. Relevant when sourceData is True.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsFirstRow
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to parse all tables inside a PRE block with the same width settings as the first row.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.EditWebPage
member.summary: The URL of the user-facing web page showing the web query data. This URL is persisted in the case that sourceData="true" and url has been redirected to reference an XML file. Then the user-facing page can be shown in the UI, and the XML data can be retrieved behind the scenes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.EditPage
member.summary: The URL of the user-facing web page showing the web query data. This URL is persisted in the case that sourceData="true" and url has been redirected to reference an XML file. Then the user-facing page can be shown in the UI, and the XML data can be retrieved behind the scenes.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Instead, please use WebQueryConnection.EditWebPage property. This property will be removed 12 months later since October 2017. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.WebQueryConnection.IsConsecutive
member.summary: Flag indicating whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as just one delimiter.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter
member.summary: Specifies properties about any parameters used with external data connections Parameters are valid for ODBC and web queries.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.SqlType
member.summary: SQL data type of the parameter. Only valid for ODBC sources.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.RefreshOnChange
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the query should automatically refresh when the contents of a cell that provides the parameter value changes. If true, then external data is refreshed using the new parameter value every time there's a change. If false, then external data is only refreshed when requested by the user, or some other event triggers refresh (e.g., workbook opened).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt string for the parameter. Presented to the spreadsheet user along with input UI to collect the parameter value before refreshing the external data. Used only when parameterType = prompt.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Type
member.summary: Type of parameter used. If the parameterType=value, then the value from boolean, double, integer, or string will be used. In this case, it is expected that only one of {boolean, double, integer, or string} will be specified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.CellReference
member.summary: Cell reference indicating which cell's value to use for the query parameter. Used only when parameterType is cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameter.Value
member.summary: Non-integer numeric value,Integer value,String value or Boolean value to use as the query parameter. Used only when parameterType is value.

member.summary: Specifies the parameter type of external connnection

member.summary: Get the parameter value from a cell on each refresh.

member.summary: Prompt the user on each refresh for a parameter value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ConnectionParameterType.Value

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType.Required
member.summary: On refresh use the existing connection information and if it ends up being invalid then get updated connection information, if available from the external connection file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType.Always
member.summary: On every refresh get updated connection information from the external connection file, if available, and use that instead of the existing connection information. In this case the data refresh will fail if the external connection file is unavailable.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.ExternalConnections.ReConnectionMethodType.Never
member.summary: Never get updated connection information from the external connection file even if it is available and even if the existing connection information is invalid

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine
member.summary: Represents user's custom calculation engine to extend the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine.Calculate(Aspose.Cells.CalculationData)
member.summary: Calculates one function with given data.
member.param: the required data to calculate function such as function name, parameters, ...etc.
member.remarks: User should set the calculated value for given data for all functions(including excel native functions) that he wants to calculate by himself in this implementation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationEngine.IsParamLiteralRequired
member.summary: Indicates whether this engine needs the literal text of parameter while doing calculation. Default value is false.
member.remarks: If this custom calculation engine requires the parameter's literal text, more stacks will be required to cache the literal text for parameters and Calculate() method may be called recursively to calcualte the parameter's value. Commonly the literal text is not needed for calculating formulas and this method should return false for most implementations to get better performance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor

member.summary: Gets the old value of the calculated cell. Should be used only in and .

member.summary: Whether the cell's value has been changed after the calculation. Should be used only in .

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.AbstractCalculationMonitor.CalculatedValue
member.summary: Gets the newly calculated value of the cell. Should be used only in .

member.summary: Implement this method to do business before calculating one cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationData.CalculatedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the calculated value for this function.
member.remarks: User should set this property in his custom calculation engine for those functions the engine supports, and the set value will be returned when getting this property. Getting this property before setting will make the function be calculated by the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells and the calculated value will be returned.

member.summary: Indicates if you need to hide the error in calculating formulas. The error may be unsupported function, external links, etc.

member.summary: The custom formula calculation functions to extend the calculation engine.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CustomEngine
member.summary: The custom formula calculation engine to extend the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CalculationMonitor
member.summary: The monitor for user to track the progress of formula calculation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.CalcStackSize
member.summary: Specifies the stack size for calculating cells recursively. -1 for this property means the calculation will use WorkbookSettings.CalcStackSize of corresponding workbook.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.PrecisionStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the strategy for processing precision of calcuation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.CalculationOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Indicates whether calculate the dependent cells recursively when calculating one cell and it depends on other cells.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy
member.summary: Enumerates strategies for handling calculation precision. Because of the precision issue of IEEE 754 Floating-Point Arithmetic, some "seemingly simple" formulas may not be calcualted as the expected result. Such as formula "=-0.45+0.43+0.02", when calcuating operands by '+' operator directly, the result is not zero. For such kind of precision issue, some special strategies may give the expected result.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy.None
member.summary: No strategy applied on calculation. When calculating just use the original double value as operand and return the result directly. Most efficient for performance and applicable for most cases.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy.Round
member.summary: Rounds the calculation result according with significant digits.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.CalculationPrecisionStrategy.Decimal
member.summary: Uses decimal as operands when possible. Most inefficient for performance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler
member.summary: Represents cells data handler for reading large spreadsheet files in light weight mode.
member.remarks: When reading a workbook by this mode, will be checked when reading every worksheet in the workbook. For one sheet, if gives true, then all data and properties of rows/cells of this sheet will be checked and processed by the implementation of this interface. For every row, will be called to check whether it need to be processed. If a row needs to be processed, properties of this row will be read firstly and user can access its properties by . if row's cells need to be processed too, then should returns true and then will be called for every existing cell in this row to check whether one cell need to be processed. If one cell needs to be processed, then will be called to process the cell by the implementation of this interface.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.StartSheet(Aspose.Cells.Worksheet)
member.summary: Starts to process a worksheet.
member.remarks: It will be called before reading cells data of a worksheet.
member.param: the worksheet to read cells data.
member.returns: whether this sheet's cells data needs to be processed. false to ignore this sheet.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.StartRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares to process a row.
member.param: the index of next row to be processed
member.returns: whether this row(properties or cells data) needs to be processed. false to ignore this row and its cells and check the next row.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.ProcessRow(Aspose.Cells.Row)
member.summary: Starts to process one row.
member.remarks: It will be called after row's properties such as height, style, ...etc. have been read. However, cells in this row has not been read yet.
member.param: Row object which is being processed currently.
member.returns: whether this row's cells need to be processed. false to ignore all cells in this row.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.StartCell(System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares to process a cell.
member.remarks: It will be called when reaching an existing cell in current row. Current row is the row of last call of .
member.param: column index of the cell to be processed
member.returns: whether this cell needs to be processed. false to ignore the cell and check the next one until reach the end of cells data of current row

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataHandler.ProcessCell(Aspose.Cells.Cell)
member.summary: Starts to process one cell.
member.remarks: It will be called after one cell's data has been read.
member.param: Cell object which is being processed currently
member.returns: whether this cell needs to be kept in cells model of current sheet. Commonly it should be false so that all cells will not be kept in memory after being processed and then memory be saved. For some special purpose such as user needs to access some cells later after the whole workbook having been processed, user can make this method return true to keep those special cells in Cells model and access them later by APIs such as Cells[row, column]. However, keeping cells data in Cells model will requires more memory and if all cells are kept then reading template file in LightCells mode will become same with reading it in normal way.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider
member.summary: Represents Data provider for saving large spreadsheet files in light weight mode.
member.remarks: When saving a workbook by this mode, will be checked when saving every worksheet in the workbook. For one sheet, if gives true, then all data and properties of rows/cells of this sheet to be saved will be provided by the implementation of this interface. In the first place, will be called to get the next row index to be saved. If a valid row index is returned(the row index must be in ascending order for the rows to be saved), then a Row object representing this row will be provided for implementation to set its properties by . For one row, will be checked firstly. If a valid column index be returned(the column index must be in ascending order for all cells of one row to be saved), then a Cell object representing this cell will be provided for implementation to set its data and properties by . After data of this cell is set, this cell will be saved directy to the generated spreadsheet file and the next cell will be checked and processed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.StartSheet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts to save a worksheet.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving a worksheet during saving a workbook. If the provider needs to refer to sheetIndex later in startRow(Row) or startCell(Cell) method, that is, if the process needs to know which worksheet is being processed, the implementation should retain the sheetIndex value here.
member.param: index of current sheet to be saved.
member.returns: true if this provider will provide data for the given sheet; false if given sheet should use its normal data model(Cells).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.NextRow
member.summary: Gets the next row to be saved.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving a row and its cells data(before ).
member.returns: the next row index to be saved. -1 means the end of current sheet data has been reached and no further row of current sheet to be saved.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.StartRow(Aspose.Cells.Row)
member.summary: Starts to save data of one row.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving a row and its cells data. If current row has some custom properties such as height, style, ...etc., implementation should set those properties to given Row object here.
member.param: Row object for implementation to fill data. Its row index is the returned value of latest call of . If the row has been initialized in the inner cells model, the existing row object will be used. Otherwise a temporary Row object will be used for implementation to fill data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.NextCell
member.summary: Gets next cell to be saved.
member.remarks: It will be called at the beginning of saving one cell.
member.returns: column index of the next cell to be saved. -1 means the end of current row data has been reached and no further cell of current row to be saved.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.StartCell(Aspose.Cells.Cell)
member.summary: Starts to save data of one cell.
member.param: Cell object for implementation to fill data. Its column index is the returned value of latest call of . If the cell has been initialized in the inner cells model, the existed cell object will be used. Otherwise a temporary Cell object will be used for implementation to fill data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.LightCellsDataProvider.IsGatherString
member.summary: Checks whether the current string value of cell needs to be gathered into a global pool.
member.remarks: Gathering string values will take advantage only when there are many duplicated string values for the cells provided by this implementation. In this situation gathering string will save much memory and generate smaller resultant file. If there are many string values for the cells provided by LightCellsDataProvider but few of them are same, gathering string will cost more memory and time and has no advantage for the resultant file.
member.returns: true if string value need to be gathered into a global pool for the resultant file.

member.summary: Sets the default standard font size.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.InterruptMonitor
member.summary: Gets and sets the interrupt monitor.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.IgnoreNotPrinted
member.summary: Ignore the data which are not printed if directly printing the file
member.remarks: Only for xlsx file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.LoadOptions.CheckExcelRestriction
member.summary: Whether check restriction of excel file when user modify cells related objects. For example, excel does not allow inputting string value longer than 32K. When you input a value longer than 32K such as by Cell.PutValue(string), if this property is true, you will get an Exception. If this property is false, we will accept your input string value as the cell's value so that later you can output the complete string value for other file formats such as CSV. However, if you have set such kind of value that is invalid for excel file format, you should not save the workbook as excel file format later. Otherwise there may be unexpected error for the generated excel file.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the string in text file is converted to numeric data.

member.summary: Creates the options for loading text file.
member.remarks: The default load file type is CSV .

member.summary: Creates the options for loading text file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.Separator
member.summary: Gets and sets character separator of text file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.SeparatorString
member.summary: Gets and sets the a string value as separator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.Encoding
member.summary: Gets and sets the default encoding.Only applies for csv file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.IsMultiEncoded
member.summary: True means that the file contains several encoding.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.PreferredParsers
member.summary: Gets and sets preferred value parsers for loading text file.
member.remarks: parsers[0] is the parser will be used for the first column in text template file, parsers[1] is the parser will be used for the second column, ...etc. The last one(parsers[parsers.length-1]) will be used for all other columns start from parsers.length-1. If one item is null, the corresponding column will be parsed by the default parser of Aspose.Cells.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.ConvertDateTimeData
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the string in text file is converted to date data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.LoadStyleStrategy
member.summary: Indicates the strategy to apply style for parsed values when converting string value to number or datetime.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.HasFormula
member.summary: Indicates whether the text is formula if it starts with "=".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadOptions.KeepExactFormat
member.summary: Indicates whether the exact formatting should be kept for the cell when converting string value to number or datetime. When ms excel loading datetime or numeric values from csv file, the formatting of those values may be changed, such as leading/tailing zeros of number, year/month/day order of datetime, ...etc. To simulate ms excel's behavior, please set this property to false. Default value of this property is true, so the cell value will be formatted as the same string value in csv template file.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please set LoadStyleStrategy property to TxtLoadStyleStrategy.BuiltIn to get same result with this property's false value and TxtLoadStyleStrategy.ExactFormat to get same result with this property's true value. This property will be removed 12 months later since February 2015. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy
member.summary: Specifies how to apply style for parsed values when converting string value to number or datetime.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy.None
member.summary: Does not set style for the parsed value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy.BuiltIn
member.summary: Set the style as built-in number/datetime when the parsed value are plain numeric/datetime values.
member.remarks: When ms excel parsing datetime or numeric values according to user's input(such as CSV file), the formatting of those values may be changed, such as leading/tailing zeros of number, year/month/day order of datetime, ...etc. This type is for simulating ms excel's behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtLoadStyleStrategy.ExactFormat
member.summary: Set the exact custom format for the parsed value to make the formatted value be same with the original input one.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.Metered
member.summary: Provides methods to set metered key.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to set metered public and private key
[C#]
Metered matered = new Metered(); matered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey");
[Visual Basic]
Dim matered As Metered = New Metered matered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey")

member.summary: Represents the number of pages tall the worksheet will be scaled to when it's printed. The default value is 1.

member.summary: Represents the number of pages wide the worksheet will be scaled to when it's printed. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: You have to set FitToPagesTall as zero if you want to fit all columns on one page.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.IsPercentScale
member.summary: If this property is False, the FitToPagesWide and FitToPagesTall properties control how the worksheet is scaled.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.GetHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a script formatting the header of an Excel file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.GetCommands(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all commands of header or footer.
member.returns: Returns all commands of header or footer.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.GetFooter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a script formatting the footer of an Excel file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PageSetup.SetHeader(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a script formatting the header of an Excel file.
member.remarks:
Script commands:
Command
Description
&P Current page number
&N Page count
&D Current date
&T Current time
&A Sheet name
&F File name without path
&"<FontName>" Font name, for exampe: &"Arial"
&"<FontName>, <FontStyle>" Font name and font style, for exampe: &"Arial,Bold"
&<FontSize> Font size. If this command is followed by a plain number to be printed in the header, it will be separated from the font height with a space character.
&"<K" Font color, for exampe(RED): &FF0000
&G Image script
For example: "&Arial,Bold&8Header Note"

members.member:
Sets a script formatting the footer of an Excel file.
0:Left Section.
1:Center Section
2:Right Section dddd Footer format script.
Script commands:
Command Description
&PCurrent page number
&NPage count
&DCurrent date
&TCurrent time
&ASheet name
&FFile name without path
&"<FontName>"Font name, for exampe: &"Arial"
&"<FontName>, <FontStyle>"Font name and font style, for exampe: &"Arial,Bold"
&<FontSize>Font size. If this command is followed by a plain number to be printed in the header, it will be separated from the font height with a space character.
&GImage script For example: "&Arial,Bold&8Footer Note"

member.summary: Copy protection info.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.AllowDeletingColumn
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The columns containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsDeletingColumnsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The columns containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Protection.AllowDeletingColumn property. This property will be removed 12 months later since June 2010. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.AllowDeletingRow
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The rows containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Protection.IsDeletingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The rows containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Protection.AllowDeletingRow property. This property will be removed 12 months later since June 2010. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions

member.summary: Creates options for saving html file.
