member.summary: Creates options for saving htm file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.PageTitle
member.summary: The title of the html page. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.AttachedFilesDirectory
member.summary: The directory that the attached files will be saved to. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.AttachedFilesUrlPrefix
member.summary: Specify the Url prefix of attached files such as image in the html file. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Specify the default font name for exporting html, the default font will be used when the font of style is not existing, If this property is null, Aspose.Cells will use universal font which have the same family with the original font, the default value is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.IsExportComments
member.summary: Indicates if exporting comments when saving file to html, the default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.DisableDownlevelRevealedComments
member.summary: Indicates if disable Downlevel-revealed conditional comments when exporting file to html, the default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.IsExpImageToTempDir
member.summary: Indicates if export image files to temp directory. Only for saving to html stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportImagesAsBase64
member.summary: Specifies whether images are saved in Base64 format to HTML, MHTML or EPUB.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true image data is exported directly on the img elements and separate files are not created.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportActiveWorksheetOnly
member.summary: Indicates if exporting the whole workbook to html file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ParseHtmlTagInCell
member.summary:
Parse html tag in cell,like
,as cell value,or as html tag,default is true

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.HtmlCrossStringType
member.summary: Indicates if a cross-cell string will be displayed in the same way as MS Excel when saving an Excel file in html format. By default the value is Default, so, for cross-cell strings, there is little difference between the html files created by Aspose.Cells and MS Excel. But the performance for creating large html files,setting the value to Cross would be several times faster than setting it to Default or Fit2Cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.HiddenColDisplayType
P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.HiddenRowDisplayType
P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.Encoding
member.summary: If not set,use Encoding.UTF8 as default enconding type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportObjectListener
member.summary: Gets or sets the ExportObjectListener for exporting objects.
member.remarks: NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Instead, please use HtmlSaveOptions.IStreamProvider property. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2015. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.FilePathProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IFilePathProvider for exporting Worksheet to html separately.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.StreamProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IStreamProvider for exporting objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ImageOptions
member.summary: Get the ImageOrPrintOptions object before exporting

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportHiddenWorksheet
member.summary: Indicating if exporting the hidden worksheet content.The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.PresentationPreference
member.summary: Indicating if html or mht file is presentation preference.The default value is false.if you want to get more beautiful presentation,please set the value to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.CellCssPrefix
member.summary: Gets and sets the prefix of the css name,the default value is "".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.TableCssId
member.summary: Gets and sets the prefix of the type css name such as tr,col,td and so on, they are contained in the table element which has the specific TableCssId attribute. The default value is "".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.IsFullPathLink
member.summary: Indicating whether using full path link in sheet00x.htm,filelist.xml and tabstrip.htm. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportWorksheetCSSSeparately
member.summary: Indicating whether export the worksheet css separately.The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportSimilarBorderStyle
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting the similar border style when the border style is not supported by browsers. If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportGridLines
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting the gridlines.The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportBogusRowData
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting bogus bottom row data. The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExcludeUnusedStyles
member.summary: Indicating whether excluding unused styles.The default value is false.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportDocumentProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting document properties.The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportWorksheetProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting worksheet properties.The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportWorkbookProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting workbook properties.The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportFrameScriptsAndProperties
member.summary: Indicating whether exporting frame scripts and document properties. The default value is true.If you want to import the html or mht file to excel, please keep the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.ExportDataOptions
member.summary: Indicating the rule of exporting html file data.The default value is All.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.HtmlSaveOptions.LinkTargetType
member.summary: Indicating the type of target attribute in <a> link,The default value is HtmlLinkTargetType.Parent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.OoxmlSaveOptions.ExportCellName
member.summary: Indicates if export cell name to Excel2007 .xlsx (.xlsm, .xltx, .xltm) file. If the output file may be accessed by SQL Server DTS, this value must be true. Setting the value to false will highly increase the performance and reduce the file size when creating large file. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.OoxmlSaveOptions.LightCellsDataProvider
member.summary: The Data provider to provide cells data for saving workbook in light mode.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.OoxmlSaveOptions.UpdateZoom
member.summary: Indicates whether update scaling factor before saving the file if the PageSetup.FitToPagesWide and PageSetup.FitToPagesTall properties control how the worksheet is scaled.
member.remarks: The default value is false for permance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.OoxmlSaveOptions.EnableZip64
member.summary: Always use ZIP64 extensions when writing zip archives, even when unnecessary.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions
member.summary: Represents the options for saving pdf file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates the options for saving pdf file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.#ctor(Aspose.Cells.SaveFormat)
member.summary: Creates the options for saving pdf file.
member.param: The save format.It must be pdf.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PrintingPageType
member.summary: Indicates which pages will not be printed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.EmbedStandardWindowsFonts
member.summary: True to embed true type fonts. Affects only ASCII characters 32-127. Fonts for character codes greater than 127 are always embedded. PDFA1B must embeded font. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.Bookmark
member.summary: Gets and sets the PdfBookmarkEntry object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Workbook converts to pdf will according to PdfCompliance in this property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.DefaultFont
member.summary: When characters in the Excel are unicode and not be set with correct font in cell style, They may appear as block in pdf,image. Set the DefaultFont such as MingLiu or MS Gothic to show these characters. If this property is not set, Aspose.Cells will use system default font to show these unicode characters.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CheckWorkbookDefaultFont
member.summary: When characters in the Excel are unicode and not be set with correct font in cell style, They may appear as block in pdf,image. Set this to true to try to use workbook's default font to show these characters first.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.SecurityOptions
member.summary: Set this options, when security is need in xls2pdf result.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.OnePagePerSheet
member.summary: If OnePagePerSheet is true , all content of one sheet will output to only one page in result. The paper size of pagesetup will be invalid, and the other settings of pagesetup will still take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.AllColumnsInOnePagePerSheet
member.summary: If AllColumnsInOnePagePerSheet is true , all column content of one sheet will output to only one page in result. The width of paper size of pagesetup will be ignored, and the other settings of pagesetup will still take effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CalculateFormula
member.summary: Indicates whether calculate formulas before saving pdf file.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PdfCompression
member.summary: Indcate the compression algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.StreamProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IStreamProvider for exporting objects.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use Border property. This property will be removed 12 months later since January 2018. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CheckFontCompatibility
member.summary: Indicates whether check font compatibility for every character in text.
member.remarks: The default value is true. Disable this property may give better performance. But when the default or specified font of text/character cannot be used to render it, unreadable characters(such as block) maybe occur in the generated pdf. For such situation user should keep this property as true so that alternative font can be searched and used to render the text instead;

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.SetImageResample(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set desired PPI(pixels per inch) of resample images and jpeg quality All images will be converted to JPEG with the specified quality setting, and images that are greater than the specified PPI (pixels per inch) will be resampled.
member.param: Desired pixels per inch. 220 high quality. 150 screen quality. 96 email quality.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the 0-based index of the first page to save.
member.remarks: Default is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.PageCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages to save.
member.remarks: Default is System.Int32.MaxValue which means all pages will be rendered..

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.CreatedTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the time of generating the pdf document.
member.remarks: if it is not be set, it will be the time of generating the pdf.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.OptimizationType
member.summary: Gets and sets pdf optimization type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.IsFontSubstitutionCharGranularity
member.summary: Indicates whether only substitute the font of character when the cell font is not compatibility for it.
member.remarks: Default is false. We will try default font of Workbook and PdfSaveOption/system for cell font first.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.GridlineType
member.summary: Gets or sets gridline type.
member.remarks: Default is Dotted type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.IgnoreError
member.summary: Indicates if you need to hide the error while rendering. The error can be error in shape, image, chart rendering, etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.OutputBlankPageWhenNothingToPrint
member.summary: Indicates whether to output a blank page when there is nothing to print.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.PdfSaveOptions.DrawObjectEventHandler
member.summary: Implements this interface to get DrawObject and Bound when rendering.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.TxtSaveOptions.AlwaysQuoted
member.summary: Indicates whether always adding '"' for each field. If true then all values will be quoted; If false then only quote values when needed(when values contain special characters such as '"' , '\n' or separator character). Default is false.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member is now obsolete. Instead, please use QuoteType property instead. This property will be removed 12 months later since August 2012. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.summary: Gets or sets how to quote values in the exported text file.

member.summary: The Data provider to provide cells data for saving workbook in light mode.

member.summary: Indicates whether leading blank rows and columns should be trimmed like what ms excel does.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType
member.summary: Specifies the type of using quotation marks for values in text format files.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Normal
member.summary: All values that contain special characters such as quotation mark, separator character will be quoted. Same with the behavior of ms excel for exporting text file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Always
member.summary: All values will be quoted always.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Minimum
member.summary: Only quote values when needed. Such as, if one value contains quotation mark but the quotation mark is not at the begin of this value, this value will not be quoted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.TxtValueQuoteType.Never
member.summary: All values will not be quoted. The exported text file with this type may not be read back correctly because the needed quotation marks being absent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.Style.Number
member.summary: Gets or sets the display format of numbers and dates. The formatting patterns are different for different regions.
member.remarks:
For example, the formatting patterns represented by numbers for en_US region:
Value Type Format String
0GeneralGeneral
1Decimal0
2Decimal0.00
3Decimal#,##0
4Decimal#,##0.00
5Currency$#,##0_);($#,##0)
6Currency$#,##0_);[Red]($#,##0)
7Currency$#,##0.00_);($#,##0.00)
8Currency$#,##0.00_);[Red]($#,##0.00)
9Percentage0%
10Percentage0.00%
11Scientific0.00E+00
12Fraction# ?/?
13Fraction# ??/??
14Datem/d/yyyy
15Dated-mmm-yy
16Dated-mmm
17Datemmm-yy
18Timeh:mm AM/PM
19Timeh:mm:ss AM/PM
20Timeh:mm
21Timeh:mm:ss
22Timem/d/yyyy h:mm
37Accounting#,##0_);(#,##0)
38Accounting#,##0_);[Red](#,##0)
39Accounting#,##0.00_);(#,##0.00)
40Accounting#,##0.00_);[Red](#,##0.00)
41Accounting_(* #,##0_);_(* (#,##0);_(* "-"_);_(@_)
42Currency_($* #,##0_);_($* (#,##0);_($* "-"_);_(@_)
43Accounting_(* #,##0.00_);_(* (#,##0.00);_(* "-"??_);_(@_)
44Currency_($* #,##0.00_);_($* (#,##0.00);_($* "-"??_);_(@_)
45Timemm:ss
46Time[h]:mm:ss
47Timemm:ss.0
48Scientific##0.0E+0
49Text@

member.summary: Specifies the stack size for calculating cells recursively. The large value for this size will give better performance when there are lots of cells need to be calculated recursively. On the other hand, larger value will raise the risk of StackOverflowException. If user gets StackOverflowException when calculating formulas, this value should be decreased.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.LanguageCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the user interface language of the Workbook version based on CountryCode that has saved the file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.Region
member.summary: Gets or sets the regional settings for workbook.
member.remarks: 1. Regional settings used by Aspose.Cells component for a workbook loaded from template file: i). For an XLS file, there are fields defined for regional settings and MS Excel does save regional settings data into the file when saving the XLS file. So, we use the saved region in the template file for the workbook. If you do not want to use the region saved in the XLS file, please reset it to the expected one (such as, CountryCode.Default) after loading the template file. And, we save the user specified value (by this method) into the file too when saving an XLS file. ii). For other file formats, such as, XLSX, XLSB...etc., there is no field defined for regional settings in the file format specification. So, we use the regional settings of application's environment for the workbook. And, the user specified value (by this method) cannot be kept for the generated files with those file formats. 2. For the view effect in MS Excel: The applied regional settings here can take effect only at runtime with Aspose.Cells component and not when viewing the generated file with MS Excel. Even for the generated XLS file in which the specified regional settings data has been saved, when viewing/editing it with MS Excel, the used region to perform formatting by MS Excel is always the default regional settings of the environment where MS Excel is running, not the one saved in the file. It is MS Excel's behavior and cannot be changed by code.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.CheckExcelRestriction
member.summary: Whether check restriction of excel file when user modify cells related objects. For example, excel does not allow inputting string value longer than 32K. When you input a value longer than 32K such as by Cell.PutValue(string), if this property is true, you will get an Exception. If this property is false, we will accept your input string value as the cell's value so that later you can output the complete string value for other file formats such as CSV. However, if you have set such kind of value that is invalid for excel file format, you should not save the workbook as excel file format later. Otherwise there may be unexpected error for the generated excel file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.AutoRecover
member.summary: Indicates whether the file is mark for auto-recovery.

member.summary: indicates whether the application last saved the workbook file after a crash.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.DataExtractLoad

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.BuildVersion

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.MemorySetting
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory usage options. The new option will be taken as the default option for newly created worksheets but does not take effect for existing worksheets.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.PaperSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the default print paper size.
member.remarks: If there is no setting about paper size,MS Excel will use default printer's setting.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.WarningCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets warning callback.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.WorkbookSettings.MaxRowsOfSharedFormula
member.summary: Gets and sets the max row number of shared formula.
member.remarks: If the number is too large, the autofilter works very slow in MS Excel 2013.
